creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: small human figure or baby floating on back in air, stretching PR arm over head, with PL shoulder and arm bent awkwardly downward, connecting to the hand of a female body mostly submerged under water; rolling hills and clouds in background
image_copyright: © Plattsburgh State Art Museum. All rights reserved.
marks:
Signature, Inscription, Label; NOT SEEN UNFRAMED
 signed and inscribed in ink, bottom right margin:
provenance: [Andrus, at least by March 28, 1974]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Drowning Woman
